result.execSummary:
The defendant Katie Mae Smith was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Surcharge], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

miscConds.notes:
Pay all mandatory costs, assessments, surcharges, victim witness surcharge, domestic violence surcharge and supervision fees as determined by DOC. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.  Any cash bail  on deposit to be applied.
Court waived all nonmandatory costs due to defendant's finanical instability.

48 USC Section 922(g)(9) prohibits possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction of a misdmeanor crime of domestic violence.
No contact with firearms.

No violent contact with the victim rising to the level of probable cause for arrest for "domestic abuse or harrassment".
No contact with firearms.
Court will consider motion for expungement if defendant pays the fine and costs,  successfully completes the sentence, and has no further violations of the law rising to the level of probable cause.

Mental health evaluation.  Take all prescribed medication(s) and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
Attend and successfully complete treatment and counseling programs as deemed appropriate by agent.
AODA and recommended treatment including random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Katie Mae Smith

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: -Denying Expungement; Received, filed and signed by the Court on September 27, 2017;   Deputy Court Clerk: TC.
Per Order of Presiding Judge, Misdemeanor Division, this motion/request is hereby assigned to the Hon. Cynthia Davis, Branch 21, calendar successor, for review. spc
CERTIFICATE OF DISCHARGE AND SATISFACTION OF PROBATION CONDITIONS FOR EXPUNGEMENT RECEIVED AND FORWARDED TO JUNE. S . OS

Defendant Katie Mae Smith in court with attorney Angel Lee Johnson.  Joshua Anthony Dryak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: LM  

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by parties and the defendant.
The court sentenced the defendant to serve 90 days in the House of Correction.
The court STAYED sentence and placed defendant on probation with the WI Department of Corrections for a period of 15 months.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
-Mental health evaluation and take all prescribed medication(s), and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
-AODA and recommended treatment including random urine screens/Maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
-Attend and successfully complete treatment and counseling programs as deemed appropriate by agent.
-NO VIOLENT CONTACT with the victim rising to the level of probable cause for arrest for "domestic abuse or harassment".
-Obtain/maintain employment.
-No contact with firearms.
-Pay all MANDATORY costs, assessments, surcharges, victim/witness surcharge, domestic violence surcharge, and supervision fees as determined by Dept of Corrections.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means. ANY CASH BAIL ON DEPOSIT TO BE APPLIED.  Court waived all non mandatory cost due to defendant financial instability.
-Restitution is set at 0.
-48 USC Section 922(g)(9) prohibits possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction of a misdemeanor crime of domestic violence.

Court will consider motion for expungement if defendant pays the fine and costs successfully completes the sentence and has no further violations of the law raising to the level of probable cause.

Defendant Katie Mae Smith in court with attorney Angel Lee Johnson.  Erika Frank Motsch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: KAR.
Case calendared for jury trial.  Case remains in jury trial posture.  Case passed.

Case recalled.  Negotiations placed on the record by the state.  On motion of the state, Court ordered Use of a Dangerous Weapon enhancer dismissed.

AS TO AMENDED COUNT 1: Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to her plea, advised of her Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire, addendum and jury instructions, received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the criminal complaint and ordered a judgment of conviction be entered on the record. Defendant further advised that if she is not a US citizen deportation is possible.

Court ordered defendant to submit a DNA sample.  Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 45.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for May 31, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Katie Mae Smith in court with attorney Angel Lee Johnson.  Benjamin Calvin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Case heard off the record. Final Pretrial held. Parties ready to proceed to trial, neither party requests to address the court on the record. Signed, Filed & Distributed, Agreed Upon Request for A New Court Date form. All conditions of bail remain in effect. Case adjourned to branch 45 for Jury Trial at 8:30 am on 5-11-2016.

Defendant Katie Mae Smith in court with attorney Angel Lee Johnson.  Erika Frank Motsch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
State has turned over an offer and discovery.  Defense requests a final pretrial and jury trial date.  Case adjourned to Branch 45.  Final pre-trial scheduled for April 12, 2016 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for May 11, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Cash bail that was previously posted to remain.
Court ordered no possession or use of any dangerous weapons or firearms.

16RM011898  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
02/27/2016

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Christopher I., Shaternell W. and Shantesha K.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Katie Mae Smith in court.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
RECALLED AT 2:27
Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Havas, Branch 45.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance.  Defendant IS Public Defender eligible.  Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  The case is adjourned to Br. 45 for a Pretrial Conference.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 15, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 3-1-16 @ 1:30 pm
